param.name: statistics_duration
param.doc: The time span of records to return, given in the form '?d', where '?' is the number of days. The duration of the records returned is from the given number of days passed to the current system time. For example, one day '1d', seven days '7d'.

method.name: GET
method.doc: To retrieve the CPU Usage Statistics using the web service, issue an HTTP GET request on the resource URI.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service.

param.name: label
param.doc: The localized label for the chart. For example, "System CPU Stats".

param.name: dateMinMaxDiff
param.doc: The difference in time between the first and last returned records in seconds.

param.name: idle_cpu
param.doc: The current total amount of idle CPU usage. (As a percentage)

param.name: system_cpu
param.doc: The current total amount of CPU usage consumed at the system level in percentage.

param.name: user_cpu
param.doc: The current total amount of CPU usage consumed at the user level in percentage.

param.name: ymax
param.doc: The value of the highest possible record. Always 100, indicating a maximum value of 100%.

param.name: x
param.doc: The time, represented as a UNIX time stamp.

param.name: y
param.doc: The average amount of CPU consumption (as a percentage) recorded during the time given in x until the next record.

param.name: set
param.doc: The type of usage. Possible values are "idlecpu", "syscpu", "usercpu".

param.name: id
param.doc: Unique identifier, the set and time values separated by a '_' character.
